newsitem.title: COTE D'IVOIRE: PRESS DIGEST - Ivory Coast - June 23.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Ivory Coast - June 23.

text.p: These are significant items in the Ivorian press on Monday. Reuters has not verified these items and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- President Henri Konan Bedie meets student leaders at his private residence in Daoukro and urges them to return to classes pending settlement of their grievances; says violent protest will bring them nothing
- Ivorian chicken farmers say their sector offers huge scope for expansion but that on an industrial level the cost of feedstuff and need for investment funds pose problems.
- Bedie remains deaf to student demands
- Ivorian opposition leader Laurent Gbagbo, head of the Ivorian Popular Front (FPI), has talks in Washington with the head of the International Monetary Fund Michel Camdessus.

- Ivory Coast's 2-1 victory over Algeria in the African Nations Cup lifts them to second place in their group and to within sight of qualification for the finals of the competition in Burkina Faso next year
